chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Krieger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: All conditions of probation shall become conditons of extended supervision should probation be revoked
Consecutive to: to any sentence currently serving

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.  Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant Brian J. Krieger in court, in custody with attorney Greg Ernest Vollan.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion held; Court questions defendant and reviews amended chg and pens (repeater stricken); no contest plea is entered in count 1; Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty and orders count 2 dismissed and read in; parties heard; defendant makes statement; Court heard and sentence is imposed:

6yr (3 yr IC/3 yr ES) imposed and stayed
3 yr p&p consecutive;
absolute sobriety;
shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
DNA
costs

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with JEE & RAG.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.

8:59 - Defendant Brian J. Krieger in court, in custody with attorney Greg Ernest Vollan.  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Address update: DCJ. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, within time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $1000 PA bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with JEE and RAG.   Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 08:30 am.
